Posts.Content: kristenpa wrote: Hey everyone, sorry if this is in the wrong place, but I've come here for support and to talk to others who have been through this experience. I'm 26 years old and found my first breast tumor when I was 23, it was the size of a grape, which it's now the size of an orange. Over the past 2-3 years I've grown 10 in total, ranging in grape size to the size of the orange. I have two giant ones, the rest are the smaller. Ultrasounds have shown that they're solid masses, I haven't had biopsies, but most have grown considerably over a 6 month period of time. I'm scheduled to have surgery on the 12th. I've never had anesthesia before and am super scared due to my health problems (PVC/SVT arrythymias, Mitral Valve Prolapse) among other things. I got my cardiac clearance yesterday, but my cardiologist said I'm still high risk. The surgeron didn't really give me a lengthy consult, it was pretty rushed due to him having surgery scheduled and I didn't get a chance to ask questions. He told me the surgery would take about an hour.  Is the type of anesthesia used up to me? I want local with sedation if I have to. I am TERRIFIED of general and would probably run out there if that was my only option. Log in to post a reply
